greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A007318 * A133080.
comment: A133084 is jointly generated with A133567 as an array of coefficients of polynomials v(n,x): initially, u(1,x)=v(1,x)=1; for n>1, u(n,x)=u(n-1,x)+(x+1)*v(n-1)x and v(n,x)=x*u(n-1,x)+v(n-1,x)+1.  See the Mathematica section. - _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 28 2012
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: (PARI) for(n=1,10, for(k=1,n, print1(if(k == n, 1, (1  - (1 + (-1)^k)/2 )*binomial(n, k) + ((1 + (-1)^k)/2)*binomial(n - 1, k - 1)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 21 2017
(MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[(1-(1+(-1)^k)/2 )*Binomial(n, k)+((1+(-1)^k)/2)*Binomial(n-1, k-1): k in [1..n]]: n in [1.. 11]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Oct 21 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 16 2007
